articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: Trump tests negative on new coronavirus test
articles.description: President Donald Trump announced Thursday that he has taken his second coronavirus test at the White House since the outbreak began and was found to be negative.
articles.content:
President Donald Trump announced Thursday that he has taken his second coronavirus test at the White House since the outbreak began and was found to be negative.
"I just took it this morning," he told a press conference. "It said the president tested negativ… [+317 chars]

articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: Italy coronavirus deaths up slightly, new cases steady
articles.description: The death toll from coronavirus in Italy has climbed by 760 to 13,915, the Civil Protection Agency said on Thursday, slightly higher than the daily rise of 727 registered a day earlier.
articles.content:
The death toll from coronavirus in Italy has climbed by 760 to 13,915, the Civil Protection Agency said on Thursday, slightly higher than the daily rise of 727 registered a day earlier.
The number of new cases was steady, growing by 4,668 from a previous 4,7… [+879 chars]

articles.author: Eleanor Burnhill
articles.title: Facing down the coronavirus - are masks a solution?
articles.description: A growing number of countries are encouraging its citizens to wear face masks outdoors but experts remain divided as to whether it's a necessary step or even a desirable one.
articles.content:
A panel of experts is meeting at the World Health Organisation today to consider whether more of us should be wearing face masks in a bid to control the spread of Covid-19.
It follows new research published in the US which suggests that a sneeze or a cough c… [+9025 chars]

articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: WHO reiterates that coronavirus is a danger to children
articles.description: The World Health Organisation reiterated its warning that children can also be affected by the new coronavirus, which has claimed the lives of several young people.
articles.content:
The World Health Organisation reiterated its warning that children can also be affected by the new coronavirus, which has claimed the lives of several young people.
"The very notion that 'Covid-19 only affects older people' is factually wrong," the head of t… [+1301 chars]

articles.author: RTÉ Sport
articles.title: Infantino sees a 'less arrogant' game after Coronavirus
articles.description: Football will be totally different when it eventually resumes after the coronavirus outbreak, FIFA chief, Gianni Infantino, said on Thursday.
articles.content:
Football will be totally different when it eventually resumes after the coronavirus outbreak, FIFA chief, Gianni Infantino, said on Thursday.
"Football will come back, and when it does, we'll celebrate coming out of a nightmare together," he told the Italian… [+845 chars]

articles.author: RTÉ Entertainment
articles.title: Comedian Eddie Large dies after coronavirus battle
articles.description: The comedian Eddie Large, who found TV fame as part of double act Little and Large, has died at the age of 78 after contracting coronavirus, his son has said.
articles.content:
The comedian Eddie Large, who found TV fame as part of double act Little and Large, has died at the age of 78 after contracting coronavirus, his son has said.

articles.title: Dolly Parton donates $1 million to coronavirus research
articles.description: Dolly Parton has donated $1 million to research into a vaccine for coronavirus and launched a new online storyline series for children in lockdown.
articles.content:
Dolly Parton has donated $1m to research into a vaccine for coronavirus and launched a new online storytelling series for children in lockdown.
